forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 47. West northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 6 to 12 mph.

weather_report:
Tonight, San Francisco offers a gentle embrace of partly cloudy skies that cradle the city. The air is crisp, with temperatures slipping into the cooler side of the spectrum, settling around 47 degrees. A light west-northwest breeze, barely rustling the leaves, contributes to a tranquil evening conducive to quiet reflection or perhaps a cozy gathering with warm drinks in hand. As the dawn breaks tomorrow, the promise of mostly sunny skies unfolds, coaxing the daytime warmth to rise to a comfortable high of around 60. Nevertheless, as the afternoon wanes, the temperatures will delicately retreat to about 58, leaving a reminder of winter’s lingering touch. 

While fog may be weaving its way through the Bay Area, it’s less of an intruder tonight and more like a soft whisper teasing the edges of visibility. The city, usually vibrant and bustling, invites a calm engagement with its sights and sounds, perfect for a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or browsing the charm of local shops. To brace against the evening chill, layers are advisable—perhaps a light jacket or cozy sweater to comfortably transition into the cooler night air. Morning joggers or dog walkers can embrace the crispness with stylish beanies and a light windbreaker, ensuring they remain in tune with the refreshing atmosphere. Whether it's sharing stories by a fire pit or enjoying a quiet moment with a favorite book, the charm of this San Francisco evening beckons all who listen.
